title: Extending an interface without overriding methods shows no error
body:
### Environment information

* `brownie` Version: v1.11.2
* `ganache-cli` v6.10.2 (ganache-core: 2.11.3)
* `solc` Version: 0.5.17+commit.d19bba13.Darwin.appleclang
* Python Version: 3.8.2
* OS: osx

### What was wrong?
Running `brownie compile` on a project with a contract extending an interface without overriding methods shows no error

Please include information like:

 - Run `brownie init`
 - Create an interface inside interfaces with:
```
pragma solidity ^0.5.17;

interface MyInterface {
    function hi() external;
}

```
 - Create a contract in contracts with:
```
pragma solidity ^0.5.17;

import "../interfaces/MyInterface.sol";

contract MyContract is MyInterface {

}

```
The output of `brownie compile` is:
```
$ brownie compile --all
Brownie v1.11.2 - Python development framework for Ethereum

Compiling contracts...
  Solc version: 0.5.17
  Optimizer: Enabled  Runs: 200
  EVM Version: Istanbul
Generating build data...
 - MyContract...

Generating interface ABIs...
Project has been compiled. Build artifacts saved at /my_home/brownie-test/build/contracts
```

when I run `dir()` in the console I get:
```
>>> dir()
[Contract, Fixed, Gui, Wei, a, accounts, alert, chain, compile_source, config, dir, exit, history, network, project, quit, rpc, run, web3]
```

If I complete the implementation with the following:
```
pragma solidity ^0.5.17;

import "../interfaces/MyInterface.sol";

contract MyContract is MyInterface {
  function hi() external {
  }
}
```

and re-run `brownie compile`, in the console I get

```
dir()Brownie environment is ready.
>>> dir()
[Contract, Fixed, Gui, MyContract, Wei, a, accounts, alert, chain, compile_source, config, dir, exit, history, interface, network, project, quit, rpc, run, web3]
```

Here's the sample project with the issue:
[brownie-test.zip](https://github.com/eth-brownie/brownie/files/5324803/brownie-test.zip)

Fixed the issue with the help from @fubuloubu 

The problem was the solc version. Upgrading to solc 0.6.8 fixed it.

```
$ brownie compile --all
Brownie v1.11.2 - Python development framework for Ethereum

Compiling contracts...
  Solc version: 0.6.8
  Optimizer: Enabled  Runs: 200
  EVM Version: Istanbul
CompilerError: solc returned the following errors:

contracts/MyContract.sol: Warning: SPDX license identifier not provided in source file. Before publishing, consider adding a comment containing "SPDX-License-Identifier: <SPDX-License>" to each source file. Use "SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED" for non-open-source code. Please see https://spdx.org for more information.

interfaces/MyInterface.sol: Warning: SPDX license identifier not provided in source file. Before publishing, consider adding a comment containing "SPDX-License-Identifier: <SPDX-License>" to each source file. Use "SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED" for non-open-source code. Please see https://spdx.org for more information.

contracts/MyContract.sol:5:1: TypeError: Contract "MyContract" should be marked as abstract.
contract MyContract is MyInterface {
^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).
interfaces/MyInterface.sol:4:5: Missing implementation: 
    function hi() external;
    ^---------------------^

âœ˜
```
